info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 2:23PM MST until December 08 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 3 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, wind chills as low as 30 below zero expected. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, blowing and drifting snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph at times. * WHERE...Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Wednesday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM Wednesday to 3 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills tonight and Wednesday morning could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Blowing and drifting snow on Wednesday may significantly reduce visibility and cause partial lane blockages.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
